contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox protected area of Australia | name = Cape Upstart National Park | iucn_category = II | image = Cape Upstart, Queensland.jpg | caption = | locator_x = | locator_y = | nearest_town_or_city = | coordinates = {{Coord|19|42|48|S|147|45|39|E|type:landmark_region:AU-QLD|display=inline,title}} | area = {{Convert|84.80|km2|sqmi|2|abbr=on}} | established = 1969 | visitation_num = | visitation_year = | managing_authorities = [[Queensland Parks and Wildlife Service]] | official_site = }} '''Cape Upstart''' is a national park in [[Queensland]], [[Australia]], 1016 km northwest of [[Brisbane]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Cape Upstart National Park|url=http://www.derm.qld.gov.au/parks/cape-upstart/index.html|work=National parks, marine parks and forests|publisher=Queensland Government|accessdate=21 December 2011}}</ref> The ''Juru'' Clan of the ''Birri-Gubba'' Tribal Group lived on Cape Upstart for thousands of years. == Cultural Importance of Cape Upstart == There are numerous middens in the sand dunes of Cape Upstart to demonstrate the connection of the ''Juru'' People to Cape Upstart.<ref name="Small">Small, M. (1992) 'Gulumba's Land': A study in ethnoarchaeology at Cape Upstart, North Queensland. BA (Hons) thesis, JCU.</ref> There are also several sacred sites, like the women's area at Worrungu Bay,<ref>Renarta Prior (Gootha), 'Juru - Knowledge Base' NQ Dry Tropics: Land & Water Solutions Website (http://wiki.bdtnrm.org.au/index.php/Juru) Accessed 9 September 2012)</ref> and the stone arrangements near Mine Island,<ref>Rowland, MJ & Ulm, S, 2011, ''Indigenous Fish Traps and Weirs of North Queensland'' Qld Archeological Research, vol.14, pp.1-58 (http://eprints.jcu.edu.au/17602/), p.18)</ref> which the senior elder always stated were never 'fish traps' but an important ceremonial ground used for initiation.<ref>Peter Prior (Gulumba), Personal Communication to Michael Small, Aaron Small & Gresham Ross, Circa.1994</ref> The ceremonial ground laid out the paths taken by ''Gubulla Munda'' (the Carpet Snake) when creating the land and islands inhabited by the Juru people and the paths followed by ''Gubulla Munda'' (the totem of the ''Juru'' Clan) in the ''Gubulla Munda Dreaming'' (the creation story of the ''Juru'' and ''Birri-Gubba'' People).<ref>Renarta Prior (Gootha), Personal Communication to Aaron Small, 25â€“26 July 2012</ref> == Native Title == In 2011 Justice Rares of the Federal Court of Australia recognised that the ''Juru'' People retained Native Title over Cape Upstart National Park.<ref name="FCA2011No2">''Prior on Behalf of the Juru (Cape Upstart) People v The State of Queensland (No.2)'' [2011] FCA 819 (26 July 2011) (http://www.austlii.edu.au/au/cases/cth/FCA/2011/819.html)</ref> This decision was the culmination of a twenty-year struggle by the ''Juru'' People to get their Native Title recognised over Cape Upstart National Park. The Process was originally started by [[Peter Prior (Gulumba)]] in 1992 and was completed by his daughter, Renarta Prior (Gootha) in 2012.<ref name="FCA2011No2" /> == References == <references /> ==See also== * [[Protected areas of Queensland]] * ''[[SS Gothenburg]]'' {{National Parks of Queensland}} [[Category:National parks of Queensland]] [[Category:North Queensland]] [[Category:Protected areas established in 1969]] {{Queensland-national-park-stub}}
